definition: lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge
old/opposite: new 新/former/worn (with age)
account/bill/debt/CL:本[ben3],筆|笔[bi3]
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds

sentences.english: Debt collectors buy old debts from companies or lenders for pennies on the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 债主从公司收旧账或者跟债务人讨小钱。
不要总翻旧账，过去的就让它过去吧。

sentences.english: Those hoping for speedy reckonings, however, will probably be disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，那些期望迅速清理旧账的人可能要失望了。
不要总翻旧账，过往的就让它过往吧。

sentences.english: MANY politicians use their memoirs to settle old scores.
sentences.chinese: 众多政治家都在他们的回忆录里算旧账揭老底。

sentences.english: Yes 2 thousand out of a Billion is NOT much. theres still plenty of them online that will bring up past issues &recently the islands?
sentences.chinese: 在网上仍然很多中国人翻旧账和讨论最近的岛屿问题。

sentences.english: I would get square with my rival on the first opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 我一有机会就要与对手算清旧账。

definition: lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge
accounts in a rotten state

old grievance/former complaint
lit. settling accounts after the autumn harvest (idiom); to wait until the time is ripe to settle accounts/to bide time for revenge
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
undisclosed account/to settle matters later/to blame sb after the event
to write off at one stroke
muddled accounts/a mess of bookkeeping
to raise the same topic
an old grudge/old scores to settle
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
lit. love debt/fig. moral obligation in consequence of a love affair/karmic consequences of a love affair
to raise the same old topic again/to hark back
to settle accounts/to clear accounts/to liquidate/to expose and criticize
